name: fenestration
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a hole or opening in a surface in the body that is natural, or created by a medical operation : The procedures included closure of extracardiac fenestration in 14 patients.fenestration of Our data show that fenestrations of the coronary sinus are often missed in preoperative evaluation.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a small fenestration of 2 mm in diameter that allows communication between the sinus and the left atrium.The fenestration was enlarged by a separate short stent.Many fenestrations closed spontaneously, or became increasingly restrictive with time.
